availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, Presbyterian minister. Garrard County native. Married to Sarah Henry Speake McKee. Father of William J. McKee, Mary McKee, Sarah L. McKee, and Samuel McKee. Graduated Centre College with a degree in literature in 1850 and from Theological Seminary in 1854. Taught school in Boyle County from 1849 to 1854 and in Columbia from 1855 to 1859. Pastor of Chestnut Street Presbyterian Church in Louisville from 1859 to 1871.

bibl.p: The Biographical Encyclopaedia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century (Cincinnati: J. M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 288. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Town of Columbia Division 1, p. 2. Find A Grave, "John Lapsley McKee (1827-1902)," Memorial #42523010, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=42523010&ref=acom (accessed August, 8, 2017).
